oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evidence of polaronic charge carriers in oxide superconductors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SRIVASTAVA, CM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: high-temperature superconductors
angle-resolved photoemission
cu-o
normal state
conductivity
optical properties of high t-c compounds
polaronic charge carriers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The analysis of photoemission and femtosecond optical absorption spectroscopy in oxide superconductors supports the view that the charge carriers are polaronic in nature. These carriers are found to exist in the (Ba/Sr)-O planes and are coupled to B-1g vibrations of the apical oxygen.
